intro: Oenanthe dielsii, commonly known as the Diels' water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, umbrella-like clusters of white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, somewhat peppery scent. Oenanthe dielsii is typically found in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
